title: Nobel Laureate's 3 Reminders: When AI Can Get Things Done, the World Will Change
description: 诺贝尔物理学奖获得者杰弗里·辛顿。
titleZh: Nobel Laureate's 3 Reminders: When AI Can Get Things Done, the World Will Change
titleEn: Nobel Laureate's 3 Reminders: When AI Can Get Things Done, the World Will Change
descriptionZh: 诺贝尔物理学奖获得者杰弗里·辛顿。
descriptionEn: Nobel Prize in Physics laureate Geoffrey Hinton. Sharing the stage with him was Alok Jha, science editor of The Economist. The venue was Messe Berlin in Berlin. Hinton said: The first thing to be rewritten isn't entertainment, but "high-value decision-making": from scanning to diagnosis, doctors' work will be re-divided. Learning will be accelerated: the pace of tutoring, mathematics, and scientific discovery will all speed up. The real risk point isn't that models can talk, but that models start "getting things done"—agent systems, open weights, making safety work have to move faster. So this article doesn't recount what he said. We'll just highlight one sentence: When AI can get things done, the world will change.
